intro: Xiphotheca rotundifolia, commonly known as the rounded-leaved xiphotheca, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its round, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features include a succulent stem and small, often hairy leaves. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
